pull.title: Adjust high nTransactionFee warning to reflect market prices.
pull.body: The 0.25BTC -paytxfee warning has been there since at least commit 7d80d2e3d7ecceb5a99fef357b118949f6dd8a79 in 2012. In line with new market prices, I've adjusted it to 0.01BTC or $4.75USD at time of writing.

events.body: @laanwj, for my information, what does ACK mean?
@laanwj, I've pushed a rebased replacement commit as per @Diapolo and your suggestion.
@laanwj, Ok, will that work? Sorry for my incompetence with C++.

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/ffeb47366df02b7f859ce3e64f2304967c837e8e for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Yeah no problem we all had to learn at some point...
ACK from me, if that counts for anything

comments.body: Could this perhaps be a constant in an obvious place, that we update from time to time?
Good point. This should be a constant in `wallet.h`.
